title: cmd/yacc: mishandling of UTF-8 literal tokens
body:
by **junyer**: 
When a UTF-8 literal token such as 'Â¬' is used, yacc puts it into yyTok2, not yyTok1 or
possibly yyTok3. I suspect that someone intended to fix this at some point because there
is an unused `UTFmax' constant floating around in there. In any case, I have attached a
patch for this. Please consider it.

$ hg identify 
52ba9506bd99 weekly/weekly.2012-02-07
$
Attachments: 1. yacc.patch (973 bytes)
